title: 111_hr4242
content: Extension and modification of election to expense certain refineries. Extension and modification of election to expense certain refineries. The definition of qualified refinery and qualified refinery property under section 179C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include refineries processing liquid fuel from crude oil, shale, tar sands, or non-virgin lube oil from used products. The amendment includes a special rule for qualified refineries producing re-refined lubricating oil, with adjusted dates for certain provisions. Additionally, subsection (e) of section 179C is amended to include "virgin" before "lube oil" and to add "or other products from used refined products" after a specific definition. The amendment adds "virgin" before "lube oil facility" in section 179C of the Code, with an effective date for property placed in service after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 45R. CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION OF RE-REFINED LUBRICATING OIL. This section adds a credit for the production of re-refined lubricating oil under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The section adds a credit for the production of re-refined lubricating oil under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit is equal to 20 cents per gallon of qualified re-refined lubricating oil produced by the taxpayer during the taxable year. Qualified re-refined lubricating oil must meet ASTM D6074 standards and be manufactured at a qualified facility from at least 95 percent used oil through a re-refining process that removes impurities. The section introduces a credit for producing re-refined lubricating oil under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. A qualified facility must comply with pollution control laws to be eligible for the credit. Additionally, there is an adjustment for inflation for taxable years after 2009. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a credit for re-refined lubricating oil production. The credit is part of the general business credit and is determined under section 45R(a). A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The amendments made by this section introduce a credit for production of re-refined lubricating oil, effective for oil produced after the enactment of this Act.
